Articles.Content:
Operation: Back To Kerbin

By TerabyteSPAAACE (Spencer McMurray)

CHAPTER 1

"3... 2... 1... Maneuver successful, guys. We have a complete, circular orbit." Bill confirmed to Jeb and Bob.

"Yes! All those years of research. All of those failed attempts! We finally have Space Station Launchbird up and we can finally orbit Kerbin, taking photos of the outer edges of the Solar System, taking readings, and hopefully we can soon get these Clamp-O-Tron Ports up and running so shuttles can dock!" Bob exclaimed.

"Guys, what do you say we head down to the Hitchhiker Storage Container and celebrate with a little bit of this?" Asked Jeb. He pulled a bottle of champagne out of a storage box.

"Jeb! KSC already said there would be no outside food or drinks in Launchbird!" Bill told Jeb.

"Well, technically, Launchbird is only the name of the Command Pod. I'm not sure that the Storage Container even has a name besides Hitchhiker." Corrected Jeb.

"Well, he is correct, Bill. Launchbird is simply the Command Pod." Bob said.

"Fine. You two go and celebrate. I'll be up here, doing what I'm supposed to be doing." Bill said with a very firm attitude.

Jeb and Bob climbed out of Launchbird and down to the Storage Container when they realized something. They forgot the champagne glasses!

"Bob, can you go get the glasses? I think I forgot them back in Launchbird." Jeb asked.

"Sure thing, Jeb. Be right back."

Bob climbed back up the ladder and floated into Launchbird.

"Hey, Bill, have you seen the champagne glasses?" Bob asked.

"Uh, n-no. I, uh, haven't seen 'em." Bill replied, shakily.

"Okay, then. I'll look around for them."

Bob searched around the Launchbird for a while when Bill finally spoke again.

"Bob? Can you come see this and make sure I'm not going insane?" He asked, signaling for Bob to come see the Control Deck.

Bob floated over to the Control Deck. Bill pointed at the Fuel Gauge Number.

"C-C-Could you read that number to me?" Bill asked, seeming even more shaky and frightened than before.

"It... It says..." Bob hesitated. He cleared his throat.

"126 mL of fuel." He finally said.

"But... But that's not possible! We calculated!" He exclaimed in fright.

"It seems that too much fuel was used breaking through the atmosphere of Kerbin, leaving us with... Well, this." Bill said.

"But we can't get home on 126 mL." Bob said, his voice breaking.

"E-Exactly, Bob. We can't get home." Bill said. His voice also starting to choke up.

"And worst of all, we aren't getting enough satellite signal to communicate through the radio, and the only way we could pick the signal back up would be to expand our orbit. Given the amount of fuel we have, the speed we would be traveling at would be about..." Bill said, stopping to think about his calculations.

"57 m/s. And the height we'd need to get to wouldn't be reached for a bit over six months." He stated. "Get ready for a long ride home."

Please tell me if you want me to continue on to...

CHAPTER 2

Edited June 29, 2013 by TerabyteSPAAACE

Add the champagne and all non-essential personnel and material to the fuel tank!

This is KSP!

EVERYTHING IS EXPLOSIVE!

Oh, and nice work mate. Well written.

Solution:

Get out and push! Scott Manley did it, and I've done it once or twice when my Mun landings went awry.

Nicely written! I reckon bring out a few more chapters before you bring them home.

(If we get a happy ending, that is...)
